content: crochet scrabble tile bag by mark thompson i ve been getting back into playing scrabble recently trying to learn all the 2 and 3 letter words and the most common 7 and 8 letter words i m a competitive person when it comes to board games we have a pretty old scrabble set though the box is held together with duct tape some of the tiles have bite marks in them and one of the w tiles got lost and replaced with a 10 point w i think it s from a french version of scrabble but the main issue i ve always had with it is that it doesn t have a bag for the tiles so each time we play we have to flip all the tiles over and awkwardly shuffle them around the box to mix them so i decided why not make my own and make it cute and scrabble themed while i was at it this pattern should produce a square 6 x 6 drawstring bag decorated like a scrabble tile that should easily hold the standard 100 tiles in a scrabble set i provided a chart for the letter s for scrabble but it could easily be customized to be your initial or any letter you want materials size g 4 25 mm hook or size needed to obtain gauge premier anti pilling dk in shades black and almond or desired brand of dk weight yarn in black and tan gauge 10 stitches x 8 row in single crochet = 2 square terms chain chain single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch half_double_crochet half_double_crochet pattern row 1 with tan ch24 starting in 2nd chain from hook sc22 through back bump sc3 in the last chain turning back down the starting chain sc21 through the top of the chains increase slip_stitch to join ch1 turn turn at the end of every row to keep the color work from slanting row 2 ws single_crochet 24 sc24 more following the color work chart slip_stitch to join ch1 turn row 3 rs sc24 following the color work chart sc24 more slip_stitch to join ch1 turn row 4-27 repeat row 2 and 3 until the colorwork chart is completed row 28 chain 3 half_double_crochet in 2nd stitch from hook slip_stitch skip one stitch half_double_crochet around slip_stitch to join ch1 row 29 single_crochet around slip_stitch to join fasten_off finishing create a 15 inch long chain in black feed through the eyelets created in round 28 weave in your ends and go play a game of scrabble
